lead_paragraph: The New Jersey Racing Commission reported yesterday that random blood tests of Breeders’ Cup horses competing at Monmouth Park this weekend were negative.The New Jersey commission, with the cooperation of racing commissions across the country and in Europe, conducted a random sampling of horses pre-entered Oct. 15 for the 11 Breeders’ Cup races. Under regulations adopted last month, the commission can conduct out-of-competition tests for the blood doping agent Epogen, known as EPO, in horses running at any of the state’s tracks. In the past, tests were conducted in the hours before or after a race.
